item.title: Google Fi has reduced the price of unlimited plans while increasing high-speed data.
item.dc:creator: Jubayar
item.description:
Google Fi is cutting the prices of its two unlimited cellular plans while also increasing the amount of high-speed data available (via 9to5Google). The Simply Unlimited plan has been reduced from $60 to $50 per month for one line, while the full-featured Unlimited Plus plan has been reduced from $70 to $65 per month for […]

The post Google Fi has reduced the price of unlimited plans while increasing high-speed data. appeared first on The Tech Journalist.
item.content:encoded:
Google Fi is cutting the prices of its two unlimited cellular plans while also increasing the amount of high-speed data available (via 9to5Google). The Simply Unlimited plan has been reduced from $60 to $50 per month for one line, while the full-featured Unlimited Plus plan has been reduced from $70 to $65 per month for one line. This is the first time the Unlimited Plus and Simply Unlimited plans have been reduced in price since their launch in 2019 and 2021, respectively.

The cheaper cost comes with more high-speed data on both plans, increasing from 22GB to 50GB with the Unlimited Plus plan and from 22GB to 35GB with Simply Unlimited. As noted on the MVNOâ€™s updated plans page, Google Fi says it will start throttling your data after you exceed either limit. And if you want to use your phone or laptop as a mobile hotspot, Google is adding 5GB for hotspot tethering to its Simply Unlimited plan, a feature previously only available with Unlimited Plus.

Both plans now come with unlimited calls to Canada and Mexico. Prior to the upgrade, you could only make free calls to Canada or Mexico when you were travelling within those countries. Google Fi is a pay-as-you-go service. With no changes to its $20 per month for one line and $10 per GB use rate, the Flexible plan now includes free calls to both countries.

Although both plans offer unlimited calling, texts, and data, the Simply Unlimited plan has a few limitations compared to the Unlimited Plus plan, including capped hotspot data usage, the inability to share data across other devices such as tablets and fewer supported destinations for free calls, texts, and data.

The post Google Fi has reduced the price of unlimited plans while increasing high-speed data. appeared first on The Tech Journalist.
